text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen so today i'm 
gonna share with you a noodle salad recipe called

laab woonsen so some of you might be familiar with 
the term laab which is a type of Thai salad usually

made up of ground meat lots of herbs really good 
really popular well this is basically that but

made also with glass noodles it is not the most 
common type of laab but you can find it at some

Thai restaurants in Thailand usually that serves 
northeastern Thai food so if you know about this

dish Thai people will be impressed you like a 
hardcore Thai food country sir alright let's

get started let's talk glass noodles first of 
all you can get this at any Asian grocery store

usually comes in little bundles like this it's 
easier to work with if you can get them come in

little bundles cuz they're really hard to separate 
from a big bunch may not be this brand any brand

will work they're actually made from beans from 
mung bean starch that's why it's gonna say bean

threads or bean vermicelli on the package so I 
have soaked these in water for about 10 minutes

just until they're soft and pliable and what 
you have to do is you got to cut them so they're

shorter otherwise it's really hard to navigate if 
you got these long things in the bowl so I just

cut them into three four pieces yeah that's good 
okay so that's that and then the other ingredient

that I like to put in my lab once in is black 
fungus mushroom does not sound very appetizing

for that's the name of it and these actually come 
dry you can get it at Asian grocery stores in the

section where they sell dried mushrooms and what 
you do is you soak that in hot water for about

10-15 minutes until they bloom and become soft 
and then for this recipe you just need to slice

it up into little ribbons they don't actually 
have a whole lot of flavor in them but it adds a

really nice crunchy texture so I like it for that 
but you can just skip it or add something else if

you'd like okay one last thing you want to talk 
about which is the most most important ingredient

in lab you cannot have a lap without this and that 
is toasted rice powder super easy to make you just

take raw rice typically we use sticky rice but 
you can use jasmine rice toasted in a dry pan

keep stirring it all the time until it becomes 
a deep golden-brown okay you can make this in

advance but I wouldn't make too much in advance 
is the longer you keep it the less aromatic they

become so I typically only make as much as I'm 
going to use for that particular recipe so this

now I'm going to grind in my modern pestle you 
can blitz it in a coffee grinder if you like

you can start to smell it in the air so good 
this is such magical powder right here so this

is what you're trying to go for notice that 
it's not a complete powder like flour because

I do like a little bit of a texture in it if 
you've listened in a coffee grinder just be

careful not to overdo it because you get it too 
fine very quickly all right apart from that I've

just got a few easy to find ingredients I got 
some ground pork we still need some protein in

this dish and a bunch of herbs I got green 
onions cilantro and mint mint is the most

important herb if you only have one go with 
the mint okay alright let's get cooking this

comes together really quickly so it's a great 
weeknight mousse so I'm gonna cook my noodles

in this pot of boiling water and the noodles 
only take about 2 to 3 minutes I'm also going

to throw in my mushrooms in there as well 
so the noodles are done and if you're not

sure you can just give it a taste and if it's 
tender it's done I'm going to now drain this

and before I shake all the liquid off I want to 
put some just a tiny little bit like a tablespoon

back in the pot you see why in a second okay 
that's good back here now this I'm gonna dump

into my mixing bowl woohoo cool that looks now 
that little bit of water in there is what I'm

gonna use to kickstart my pork you can use ground 
chicken by the way totally totally fine and I'm

gonna add my ground pork in here and that little 
bit of water will just help lubricate it prevent

it from sticking front to the bottom too much 
but you don't want to put too much water in there

because then you end up with a ton of water that 
you'll need to drain off and you don't want to

drain off any pork juices cuz that's good flavor 
you know how I love mini kitchen utensils well the

only thing about it is your hand gets really hot 
because it's so close to the flame but that's okay

we sacrifice for cuteness so this technique in 
Thai it's called blue one for those of you who are

interested just cooking a little bit of cooking in 
just a little bit of water that is done I'm gonna

turn that off and then this goes directly into my 
mixing bowl along with all the yummy pork juices

cuz in there also is pork fat which is going to 
help lubricate our salad because as you may notice

there's no fat at it at all no oil no nothing okay 
so now while this is still hot I'm gonna add what

should be thinly sliced shallots but since I ran 
out of shallots I'm using red onion instead which

is something you could totally do yeah let's put 
it all in give that a quick toss and by adding the

onions while this is still hot it'll help wilt the 
onion a little bit make it a little less pungent

and still while that's still hot we're gonna go 
in with our seasoning which is very simple lap is

to seasoning fish sauce for saltiness and lime 
juice for tartness of course this being lab it

has to be spicy so I'm gonna add chilli flakes so 
the chilli flakes that we use is actually dry Thai

chilies that you toast until it's nice and smoky 
and then we grind that up so you get not just the

spice but a little bit of smokiness as well or 
you can just use regular chili flakes whoo that

smells spicy already and I it looks like I only 
put a little bit cuz that stuff is strong right

before you eat you want to add your toasted rice 
powder and your fresh herbs and you don't want

to do this far in advance cuz otherwise your herbs 
will wilt and it won't look pretty and the toasted

rice powder will absorb some of that dressing 
and four-lap you want to be really generous

with your herbs and that's it dinner is served 
oh just love the smell of laughs and it's such

an iconic smell till you smell that and it's like 
yep that is laughs could not possibly be anything

else and this recipe does make an enormous amount 
of salad but I wanted to use up the whole packet

of rice noodles which usually comes in 40 gram 
packets because it's really difficult to separate

them and you know so now normally we eat lap 
with sticky rice but because this already has

carbs in it I find it doesn't need it also lab 
usually comes with a lot of fresh vegetables a

cucumber cabbage or something but again because 
this already has the mushrooms and it's not as

heavy as a typical meat-centric lab that I don't 
find it needs all that as much but you definitely

can you can't eat this on its own but I think 
it's more of like a refreshing side dish to a

bigger meal but I have been known to just it 
down to pull up this and just eat it for lunch

lab is such a great representation of what Thai 
food is all about it's sour it's spicy but it's

also well-rounded with that toasted rice so that 
gives it I don't know that kind of like rounds

out the really sharp edges of the lime and all the 
herbs that come through there's just it's really

hard to describe if you've never had a lab but 
it's just a well-balanced flavor but at the same

time very bold very strong and very refreshing 
love it this will be a great side dish to like

some barbeque chicken or any sort of heavier meats 
delicious but you know what as I said I have been

known to just sit down to a bowl this and have it 
for lunch because it's so addictive so the recipe

as always will be on hot Thai Kitchen calm and 
for those of you who are our patreon members with

access to the bonus show after the show today I'm 
going to talk to you about some other more obscure

variations of lab that you can try at home and if 
you want to know more about joining us on patreon

up to the link in the description below if you 
haven't subscribed to the show make sure you do

so you don't miss a recipe and click the bell icon 
as well so you get a notification when I post a

new video thank you as always for watching and I 
will see you next time for your next edition time
